intro: Treubia, commonly known as the golden saxifrage, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. These plants are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and small, clustered flowers that often have yellow or orange petals. Treubia species are typically found in moist, rocky habitats and are native to regions in Europe, Asia, and Africa. They are known for their ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and their resilience to cold climates. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage and flowers.
